data.title: Arvind Kejriwal - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
Arvind Kejriwal (Hindi pronunciation: (/wiki/Help:IPA/Hindi_and_Urdu "Help:IPA/Hindi and Urdu"); born 16 August 1968) is an Indian politician, activist and former bureaucrat, who served as the 7th Chief Minister of Delhi. He was the chief minister from 2013 to 2014 and from 2015 to 2024. He is also the national convener of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) since 2012. He represented the New Delhi constituency in the Delhi Legislative Assembly from 2015 to 2025, and previously from 2013 to 2014. [...] Retrieved from ""

data.title: Arvind Kejriwal - Biography - IMDb
data.snippet:
Arvind Kejriwal (born 16 August 1968) is an Indian politician who is the Chief Minister of Delhi since February 2015. He previously served as Chief Minister from December 2013 to February 2014, stepping down after 49 days. He is the national convener of the Aam Aadmi Party. His party won the 2015 Delhi Assembly elections with a majority, obtaining 67 out of 70 assembly seats.  
    
  Kejriwal is a graduate of the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, and worked in the Indian Revenue Service as a Joint Commissioner of the Income Tax Department in New Delhi. [...] In 2012, he launched the Aam Aadmi Party, and the party won in the 2013 Delhi Legislative Assembly election. Following the election, he took office as the Chief Minister of Delhi on 28 December 2013. He resigned 49 days later, on 14 February 2014, stating he did so because of his minority government's inability to pass his proposed anti-corruption legislation due to a lack of support from other political parties.  
    
  On 14 February 2015, he was sworn in as Chief Minister for a second term after his party's victory in the Delhi Assembly election [...] In 2006, Kejriwal was awarded the Ramon Magsaysay Award for Emergent Leadership recognising his involvement in the grassroots movement Parivartan using right-to-information legislation in a campaign against corruption. The same year, after resigning from the IRS, he donated his Magsaysay award money as a corpus fund to found the Public Cause Research Foundation, a non-governmental organisation (NGO).

data.title: Arvind Kejriwal | Life, Anti-Corruption Activism, Aam Aadmi Party ...
data.snippet:
Arvind Kejriwal (born August 16, 1968, Hisar, Haryana state, India) is an Indian social activist and politician best known for being the founder and leader of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP; ‚ÄúCommon Man‚Äôs Party‚Äù). A former Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer turned activist, he founded the AAP in 2012 and led it to a landslide victory in the 2015 Delhi Legislative Assembly elections. He served three terms as chief minister of Delhi.

## Early life and career

Kejriwal was born in Hisar, a city in Haryana state, India. He went on to study mechanical engineering at the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur in West Bengal state, graduating in 1989. [...] Facebook X

Kejriwal was arrested after failing to appear before the ED for questioning after nine summonses. He was granted bail by the Supreme Court on September 13, 2024, and resigned his post as chief minister days after leaving jail. AAP leader Atishi replaced him as chief minister until fresh elections were held in February 2025. AAP lost the election to the BJP and Kejriwal lost his seat in the assembly.

Sanat Pai Raikar

data.title: [PDF] Shri Arvind Kejriwal was sworn as the Chief Minister of Delhi for the ...
data.snippet: in 2006. Shri Arvind Kejriwal is a Social Activist, Political Reformer and a former Joint Commissioner in the Income Tax Department and is widely known for his commitment towards the Right to Information and struggle for the anti-corruption crusade in form of Jan Lokpal Bill. Shri Arvind Kejriwal was born on 16 August 1968 at Village Siwani in Hisar District of Haryana. He is married to Smt. Sunita Kejriwal. The couple has two children, Harshita Kejriwal and Pulkit Kejriwal. His parents also live with him. Shri Arvind Kejriwal before entering politics had formed an NGO namely ‚ÄúParivartan‚Äù to address citizens's grievances related to Public Distribution System (PDS), public related works, social welfare schemes, income tax and electricity. He resigned from the Income Tax Department in 2006 [...] Shri Arvind Kejriwal was sworn as the Chief Minister of Delhi for the third consecutive term at Ramlila Maidan on 16th February, 2020. He was sworn as the Chief Minister for the second time on February 14, 2015 at the age of 46 years. Earlier, he became the youngest Chief Minister of Delhi when he was sworn for the first time on 28 December 2013. He is the current and 7th Chief Minister of Delhi since February 2015. In 2012, he launched the Aam Aadmi Party and he is the National Convener of the Aam Aadmi Party Shri Arvind Kejriwal is an almuni of IIT Kharagpur and completed his B. Tech in Mechanical Engineering in 1989. He was selected for the Indian Revenue Service in 1993 and was awarded the Ramon Magsaysay award for Emergent Leadership in 2006. Shri Arvind Kejriwal is a Social Activist, [...] He resigned from the Income Tax Department in 2006 and in the same year, he donated his Magsaysay award money as a corpus fund to set-up the Public Cause Research Foundation.

data.title: Cheif Minister of Aam Aadmi Party Arvind Kejriwal Family Tree
data.snippet:
### üèõÔ∏è Political Career

Kejriwal's political journey began in earnest with the 2011 India Against Corruption movement, where he collaborated with activist Anna Hazare to advocate for the Jan Lokpal Bill. In 2012, diverging from Hazare's apolitical stance, Kejriwal established the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) to pursue political avenues for systemic change.

In the 2013 Delhi Legislative Assembly elections, AAP made a significant impact by securing 28 out of 70 seats. Kejriwal became Chief Minister but resigned after 49 days due to challenges in passing the Jan Lokpal Bill. [...] # Cheif Minister of Aam Aadmi Party Arvind Kejriwal Family Tree

 03 May, 2025

Here is a detailed overview of Arvind Kejriwal's family tree, highlighting his immediate and extended family members:

### üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Immediate Family

#### üßî Arvind Kejriwal

 Born: August 16, 1968, in Siwani, Bhiwani district, Haryana.
 Profession: Indian politician, activist, and former bureaucrat; founder of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP); served as the Chief Minister of Delhi from 2013 to 2014 and from 2015 to 2024.

#### üë© Wife: Sunita Kejriwal

 Profession: Former Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer; met Arvind during their training at the National Academy of Administration in Mussoorie.
 Role: A pillar of support throughout Arvind's journey from civil service to politics.

#### üëß Daughter: Harshita Kejriwal [...] In 1995, he joined the Indian Revenue Service (IRS) as an Assistant Commissioner of Income Tax. During his tenure, he became increasingly aware of systemic corruption, which motivated his transition to activism. In 2000, he founded "Parivartan," an NGO aimed at assisting citizens in navigating government bureaucracy and combating corruption.

His efforts in promoting transparency and the Right to Information (RTI) movement earned him the Ramon Magsaysay Award for Emergent Leadership in 2006.
